alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 8:55PM CDT until May 03 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. .The Red Lake River at Crookston continues to fall as upstream points have crested. Crest appears to have occurred early Monday at 27.07 feet. River levels will remain within Major flood stage through Tuesday, with an expected drop to Moderate stage by Wednesday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MAY 03... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Red Lake River at Crookston. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, May 03. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Lowest level of uncertified levee system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 25.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Monday was 26.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 14.7 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
